metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14400 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.7-1 Q16, the PersistPixelCache function in magick/cache.c mishandles the pixel cache nexus, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference in the function GetVirtualPixels in MagickCore/cache.c) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0319-CVE-2017-14400-Fix-DoS-NULL-pointer-dereference-in-PersistPixelCache.patch in wheezy same fixes as CVE-2017-14325

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11').
